meanings.definition: Ceased work or activity in order to relax or recover strength.
meanings.sent1: After a long day of playing outside, the child rested on the couch.
meanings.sent2: She always feels better after she has rested for a while.
meanings.sent3: The tired puppy rested in the shade, dreaming of chasing squirrels.
meanings.sent4: The old tree rested its branches, ready to bloom in the spring.
meanings.sent5: The athlete rested before the big race, visualizing success in his mind.

meanings.sent1: The cat lay on the soft, rested pillow.
meanings.sent2: The bridge looked sturdy and well-rested on its strong pillars.
meanings.sent3: The tired hiker found a well-rested rock to sit on and enjoy the view.
meanings.sent4: The roof rested on the solid walls of the house, protecting it from the rain.
meanings.sent5: The tired bird perched on a well-rested branch, chirping happily in the sun.

meanings.sent1: Only a few cookies were left in the jar, the rest rested on the plate.
meanings.sent2: The sun dipped below the horizon, leaving a rested glow in the sky.
meanings.sent3: The tired students left the classroom, while the rest rested for the next lesson.
meanings.sent4: The worn-out toys were thrown away, but the rest rested on the shelf.
meanings.sent5: The exhausted team members left the meeting early, while the rest rested and continued discussing ideas.
